oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scrap book from the DeLany Family of Ohio
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The DeLany family lived in Ohio and three brothers served in the Union Army in the 30th Ohio Inf. Regt., USA. Some of the family relocated to Cleveland, Tennessee after the Civil War. These pages reference the military service of several DeLany men and includes Civil War and Indian War era service. Included in the scrapbook was a photograph of the train car which transported Abraham Lincoln's body from Washington back to Illinois.
